General course objectives:
General course objectives
The course provides the students with an overview to relevant control issues of power systems and gives knowledge about operational integration of wind power.
Analysis of the different electrical wind turbines technologies and their interaction with the grid both during transients and steady states.
Modelling of wind turbines, load flows and influence on system frequency and voltages are investigated with the usage of the simulation software DIgSILENT - Powerfactory.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Analyze power system operation principles
Explain the role of voltage and frequency control in power systems
Perform load flow calculations in meshed grids
Explain the main types of wind turbines
Describe advanced stationary and dynamic models of wind turbines
Create wind power and power systems models in Powerfactory
Verify grid code compliance
Assess how wind turbines can support power system secure operation
Ability to define your own research questions
Ability to work in groups and effective oral communication
Content:
Power system operation principles. Wind power and wind generator types.
Modeling of wind turbines and large wind farms.
Impact of wind on power systems stability, particularly on frequency and voltage.
Frequency and voltage control and compliance with grid codes.
Static and dynamic simulation studies with Powerfactory.
